intro: Lepechiniella persica subsp. wendelboi, commonly known as Persian carpet grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It is a perennial herb with small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has a low-growing habit, with slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, particularly in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
